result.execSummary:
The defendant Spencer R. Jural was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Spencer R. Jural is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Spencer R. Jural was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Spencer R. Jural

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing after revocation - 9/3/15 (paper copy retained in 15cf174)

11:32 a.m. Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Spencer R. Jural in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf75, 15cf78 and 15cf174. In 15cf174 Schiek intends to add OWI PAC count - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Rielly requests arraignment today -State will file amended complaint to include PAC count - Not guilty plea entered. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
In 15cf75 and 15cf78 - Schiek/Rielly/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing on revocation.
Court sentence
In 15cf75
Jail - 30 days  with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 52 days
In 15cf78 
6 months - consecutive with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 83 days 
Will allow inpatient treatment during last 30 days at Koinonia - Must successfully complete to receive credit
Appeal rights given
Adj. 11:53 a.m.

3:19 p.m. Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court, via video, with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Spencer R. Jural in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Calling 15cf78, 15cf75 and 15cf175.  In 15cf174 in receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Attorney Rielly requests preliminary hearing - Waive time limits. In 15cf75 and 15cf78 matter of revocation sentencing will be taken up on September 3, 2015 at 11:30 a.m. 
Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 11:30 am. Adj. 3:21 p.m.

3:10 p.m. Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf75 and 15cf78.  Court questions defendant regarding counsel; defendant states he contacted PD's office last week and was told counsel would be here. Off record 3:11 p.m.
3:19 pm
Attorney Michael Rielly appears telephonically with leave of court requests matter be adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Adj. 3:20 p.m.

03:13 pm - Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf75, 15cf78 and 15fo440.  State moves to dismiss 15fo440, Count 2 in 15cf75 and amend count 1 to Poss THC 1st offence and in case 15cf78; amend count 1 to misdemeanor bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) and dismiss counts 2 through 4 - Granted.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek statement concerning Langalde County charges - Will not be charging with bail jumping.  Schiek/Rielly/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 12 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Jail credit 31 days 14cf78
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:16 pm - Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf75, 15cf78 and 15fo440.  Schiek states case are not resolved as of today's date, defendant has picked up new charges in Lincoln County.  Will proceed with Arraignment today.  Rielly - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas in both cases.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

08:35 am - Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Spencer R. Jural in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State calls Oneida County Deputy Timothy Gensler/Sworn/Direct by Schiek - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Rielly.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Information will mirror criminal complaint.  Rielly enters not guilty pleas on behalf of defendant.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

02:53 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court, via video, with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Defendant Spencer R. Jural in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15fo440, 15cf78 and 15cf75.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.  Prelim time limits waived.  Rielly/Bednar statement/motion to modify bond - Currently set at $2500 cash bond in 15cf78.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
defendant appeared on new case and Br II put to 4-20

01:48 pm - GBA for PFO - Defendant Spencer R. Jural in court, via video, in custody.  Atty Richard Shawl appears for today's purposes only.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, defendant has contacted PD office.  Schiek/Shawl statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing time limits.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
